Precious metals had risen to all-time highs that shocked even seasoned traders.

title: Warsh’s Return Revives Tensions Over the Fed’s $6.6 Trillion QE Hangover
summary: Now, with his selection of former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh — an economist known as much for his fierce criticism of the central bank as his views on monetary policy — the debate has abruptly shifted from short-term rates to the Fed’s $6.6 trillion balance sheet and its very role in markets.  “He’s been very critical of the Fed’s balance sheet expansion,” said Zach Griffiths, head of investment-grade and macro strategy at CreditSights.

title: Has Goldcom (GOLD) Already Reflectied Its Strong Multi Year Share Price Run
summary: If you are wondering whether Gold.com is still reasonably priced after its strong run, or if you might be looking at a stock that has already done the hard work, this article will help you frame that question clearly. Gold.com recently closed at US$51.85, with returns of 20.3% over 7 days, 49.1% over 30 days, 49.1% year to date, 88.8% over 1 year, 51.7% over 3 years and 270.7% over 5 years. title: Chinese Speculators Set the Stage for Gold and Silver Crash
summary: On Friday, exhausted traders watched in shock as the precious metal plunged by that much in less than twenty hours.  For weeks, traders across the metals world have spent their nights glued to screens as prices for everything from gold to copper and tin seemed to break free from the gravity of supply and demand fundamentals, spurred higher on a wave of hot money from speculators in China.

title: Warren Buffett Said If He Were 30 Starting Over With $1M, He'd Put It All In A Low-Cost Index Fund Then 'Forget It And Go Back To Work'
